definition: otaku, a Japanese term for people with obsessive interests such as anime, manga, and video games/see also 宅男[zhai2 nan2]/see also 宅女[zhai2 nu:3]
to defend/to resist
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: The area where otaku have the most influence in manga tends to be with dojinshi.
sentences.chinese: 御宅族在漫画领域最有影响的是同人志。

sentences.english: These shops attract many otaku, and forms unique culture of Akihabara.
sentences.chinese: 吸引了大量的御宅族，形成了独特的秋叶原文化。

sentences.english: Because of this the otaku subculture has much influence over the mainstream anime industry in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 因此御宅族亚文化对日本主流动画产业有巨大影响。

sentences.english: There are also many femal otaku in the society nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 当今社会也有许多女御宅族。

sentences.english: This is where you'll find the otaku, Japanese uber-nerds whose lives revolve around comic books and computers.
sentences.chinese: 在这里你会见识到日本痴迷于漫画和电脑的御宅族。
